abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority chairman Thomas F Prendergast says agency will not raise fares in order to cover $32 billion capital plan, which is currently running a $14 billion budget gap.
lead_paragraph: Two days after another Metropolitan Transportation Authority official said a fare increase might be necessary, the agency’s chairman categorically ruled out such a move.

headline.main: M.T.A. Chief Rejects Higher Fares for Capital Plan
headline.print_headline: Transit Chief Rejects Higher Fares for Capital Plan

snippet: Two days after another Metropolitan Transportation Authority official said a fare increase might be necessary, the agency’s chairman categorically ruled out such a move.
